message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DM, cs.SI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a method of proving impossibility results based on applying strong data-processing inequalities to estimate mutual information between sets of variables forming certain Markov random fields. This method is applicable to a wide range of problems on graphs, including reconstruction problems. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also involves machine learning and statistical inference, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also discusses community detection, which is a topic in cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
